name: High Protein Athletic Focus
title: High Protein Athletic Focus
description: Tailored to your health goals and preferences

meals.description: High-protein oatmeal with Greek yogurt and berries for sustained energy
instructions: Cook oats with 1 cup water for 5 minutes until creamy
Let cool for 2 minutes, then stir in protein powder
Top with Greek yogurt, sliced banana, and blueberries
Drizzle with almond butter and honey
Mix gently and serve immediately
meals.goal_alignment: Perfect pre-training meal 2-3 hours before evening workout. High protein for muscle recovery, complex carbs for sustained energy.

meals.description: Lean chicken breast with quinoa and vegetables for midday fuel
instructions: Season chicken with salt, pepper, and herbs. Grill for 6-7 minutes per side
Cook quinoa according to package directions (about 15 minutes)
Cube sweet potato and roast at 400°F for 20 minutes
Steam broccoli for 5 minutes until tender-crisp
Warm black beans in microwave for 1 minute
Assemble bowl with quinoa base, top with chicken, vegetables, and sliced avocado
Drizzle with olive oil and season to taste
meals.goal_alignment: Midday protein boost for muscle maintenance. Complex carbs provide steady energy for afternoon activities before evening training.

meals.description: Post-workout recovery meal with omega-3s and lean protein
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F
Cook brown rice according to package directions
Slice sweet potato into wedges, toss with half the olive oil, roast 25 minutes
Season salmon with salt, pepper, minced garlic, and lemon juice
Pan-sear salmon skin-side down for 4 minutes, flip and cook 3 minutes more
Sauté asparagus with remaining olive oil for 5 minutes
Serve salmon over rice with roasted sweet potato and asparagus
meals.goal_alignment: Ideal post-training meal within 30-60 minutes after workout. High-quality protein for muscle recovery, healthy fats for anti-inflammatory benefits.

meals.description: Evening recovery snack with casein protein for overnight muscle repair
instructions: Mix Greek yogurt and cottage cheese in a bowl until smooth
Layer half the yogurt mixture in a glass or bowl
Add half the berries and a sprinkle of granola
Add remaining yogurt mixture
Top with remaining berries, granola, and chopped almonds
Drizzle with honey before serving
meals.goal_alignment: Evening snack 1-2 hours before bed. High in casein protein for overnight muscle recovery and repair during sleep.

days.day_notes: Optimal nutrition timing for evening training: breakfast 3 hours before, light lunch 4-5 hours before, dinner within 1 hour post-workout, and evening snack 1-2 hours before bed for recovery.

variety_score: This plan provides excellent variety with different protein sources (chicken, salmon, Greek yogurt, cottage cheese), diverse cooking methods (grilling, roasting, steaming), and a range of nutrient-dense whole foods to support athletic performance.
goal_alignment: This meal plan is specifically designed for marathon training with strategic protein timing around evening workouts. Each meal provides optimal protein for muscle recovery while maintaining caloric targets for weight management. The timing supports pre-training energy and post-training recovery.
shopping_tips: Buy chicken and salmon in bulk and freeze portions. Pre-cook quinoa and brown rice in batches. Wash and prep vegetables on prep day. Keep Greek yogurt, cottage cheese, and protein powder stocked as reliable protein sources. Choose frozen berries for consistent availability and cost-effectiveness.
